reviewText: Crenna was good in thes flick as far as westerns go he does a good job as a cowboy, story plot was interesting despite it being a foreign made western
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: I liked this movie well enough, but have it with another set, and won't be watching this one very often. I do recommend it for all ages, it's good family entertainment. Thanks, Bobby J.
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: this vhs tape was really good. I had seen it years ago and wanted to see it again. Richard Crenna is so good. I love the old westerns and I'm sure you will enjoy seeing it too.
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: Have just watched the remastered version and thought I was in for a treat when the opening scenes stayed close to the book.  But extremely disappointed with the second half when even expected dramatic licence went over the top for Spaghetti western pyrotechnics.I could only recommend to those whose challenge is to collect all Louis L'Amour based films as opposed to someone wanting a good western to watch.
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: italian western...Richard Crenna stars as a man who is called "Noon" because he has amnessia and has no other name.As he wanders the west searching for his identity,he learns that he is seeking revenge for the murders of his wife and child. With the help of an outlaw named Rimes (Stephen Boyd) and a beautiful woman he sets out to find the man responsible for killing his family...a Louis L'Amour storey...dvd quality...Front Row Features dvd says remastered picture and sound with features,however sound is good,picture is a vhs transfer,no real features to talk about except for chapter stops and two actors bio's...so good storey,hard to get dvd,try to get better dvd copy if possible but price only $ 12.99 for this copy.
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: I first saw Richard Crenna in the TV Series "The Real McCoys" and have been a fan of his work ever since.  Most moviegoers have probably seen him in the Rambo Trilogy and some maybe in "Catlow" or "Breakheart Pass".  This is a Spaghetti Western that has shootouts, a mystery to solve and a damsel in distress.  If you like Richard Crenna, you are going to like this movie.  He plays a gun for hire in certain situations and the tough guy that I had not seen him play before. All in all an entertaining film.
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS

reviewText: As a Louis Amour fan, the story line drifted a bit off center, but was entertaining. For fans, this is an okay read
Title: The Man Called Noon VHS
